item.title: Multiple Lamp Posts with Shell EV charging points are out, 20th February
item.description:
Multiple Lamp Posts in central Sidcup with Shell EV charging points are out following 1-2 second brown out around 17:00 on Monday 16/02/2026. All post where Shell EV charging point have been installed in the past year are affected in Clarence Road, Clarence Crescent, Birkbeck Road, Granville Road, St john Road, Highview Road. Examples: post 2 Clarence Road, post 3 Clarence Crescent, posts 4 & 11 Birkbeck Road and post 7 Granville Road. This has happened a number of times. However, older Shell EV charging points are working still eg Post 1 Clarence Road. Suspect newer post have had circuit protection that is too sensitive installed compared with older installs? Council needs to check old install VS new correct the issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clarence Road, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car no tax, 20th February
item.description:
This vehicle turned up 2 weeks ago and parked in residents parking bay it doesn't have any tax it ran out 1 September 2025 that makes 6 cars parked in chilver Street without either mot or tax please rbg do something about the parking on this and dandridge close as residents can't park where they live thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dandridge Close, Greenwich

item.title: The section of valentine avenue not been resurfaced since 2012, 20th February
item.description:
The end section of valentine avenue not been resurfaced since 2012 you can also see this from Google maps, from the corner of steynton avenue to the end of valentine avenue there is a clear difference between this part of the road and the rest. When I raised this ticket previously it was dismissed that the road is in line with service agreement but if that was the case the rest of the road would look the same? Please make it make sense? Why has the rest of the road been tarmac'd and not this section?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valentine Avenue, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish on corner of Littlestone Cl and Stevens Cl and in bush, 20th February
item.description:
Dumped rubbish, including a plastic bin, next to the bushes at the corner of Littlestone Close and Stevens Close. There is also still rubbish all around the bushes that run alongside the front of Littlestone Close, e.g. cans, food packaging and even what looks like a hoodie, particularly in the section of foliage running along the front of 32-34 Littlestone Close. You are able to step over the low wooden fence to get it. Thank you so much!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Littlestone Close, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: People purposefully dropping dog poo in front of recycling, 20th February
item.description:
There is a specific individual that puts dog poo on the plastic recycling and now someone must have been annoyed and thrown on the ground. People walk down there to get the station or bus stop and elderly resident s reside there so risk of stepping on this. Dog fouling is illegal worse putting in someoneâ€™s bin. Either Bromley council provides locks for our bins to stop this person or someone will confront her and it will be an issue for the police. We just ask that residents are reminded to collect their dog litter or provide a bin near the bench so people can put the rubbish away. The nearest bin is Valley school or Warner Road - nothing on Highland Road!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highland Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked access AGAIN, 20th February
item.description:
Yet again our access is blocked , this is a fire exit as well as an area we use for staff access and parking. I have reported so many issues here. We urgently need a keep clear sign painted on the round for our property. This is Churchill way, rear of Robert dyas. We are getting issues with the mosque and blue badge holders.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
